p: Lamiaceae is a plant family from the MENA region with potential anti-TB activity. It contains 48 different plant species that have been tested against TB. Amongst all medicinal plant families, the Lamiaceae plant family has received considerable attention from researchers because they contain different bioactive compounds and are easily soluble in various solvents, including methanol, ethanol and water ( Milevskaya et al., 2019). Hydro-distilled extracts and fraction from the leaves, long stems and flowers of P. odorata, B. papyrifera, E. camaldulensis, I. helenium, K. senegalensis, N. sativa seeds R. officinalis and genus Cymbopogon exhibit the highest number of activities against TB.
